com.imc.context.filters

Interface FilterFactory


  • public interface FilterFactory
    A factory which is responsible for creating data structures to support user filtering.

    • Method Summary

      • getCondition

        Condition getCondition(BusinessAttribute attribute,
                       Object value,
                       Condition.OPERATOR operator)
        Get a new where condition based on a data attribute for user filtering. Example of usage:
        • WorkflowItem status = STARTED: getCondition(Schema.workflowItemStatus, "STARTED", OPERATOR.EQUAL)
        • WorkflowItem start within last 7 days: Calendar dateOpen = Calendar.getInstance(); dateOpen.add(Calendar.DATE, -7); getCondition(Schema.workflowItemDateOfOpen, dateOpen, OPERATOR.GREATER_THAN_EQUAL)
        • Workflow name contains ABC (case insensitive): getCondition(Schema.objectName, "ABC", OPERATOR.CONTAINS)
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute (predicate) for the condition
        value - The value to match against
        operator - The operator to use, typically is Contains
        Returns:
        The formed condition.

      • getCondition

        Condition getCondition(BusinessObject primaryBO,
                       Condition.OPERATOR operator)
        Get a new where condition based on a business object for user filtering.
        Parameters:
        primaryBO - The BO filter
        operator - The operator to use
        Returns:
        The formed condition

      • getCondition

        Condition getCondition(BusinessType type)
        Get a new where condition based on a business type.
        Parameters:
        type - The BusinessType
        Returns:
        The formed condition

      • getCondition

        Condition getCondition(BusinessType type,
                       BusinessRelationAttribute attribute,
                       BusinessAttribute objectField,
                       Object value,
                       Condition.OPERATOR operator)
        Get a new where condition based on a related object's business data attribute for user filtering. Example of usage:
        • Quotes which belongs to account with name containing ABC: getCondition(Schema.Account, Schema.quoteContainedBy, Schema.objectName, "ABC", OPERATOR.CONTAINS)
        • Quotes which belongs to Opportunity with volume less than 1000: getCondition(Schema.Opportunity, Schema.quoteContainedBy, Schema.opportunityVolume, 1000, OPERATOR.LESS_THAN)
        Parameters:
        type - The businessType that the attribute refers to.
        attribute - The relationship.
        objectField - The field of the object to filter by.
        value - The value to filter by.
        operator - The operator to use.
        Returns:
        The formed condition.

      • getCondition

        Condition getCondition(Collection<BusinessType> type)
        Get a new where condition based on business types.
        Parameters:
        types - The BusinessTypes
        Returns:
        The formed condition

      • getOrder

        Order getOrder(BusinessAttribute field,
               boolean desc,
               boolean caseSensitive)
        Get a new Order based on data attributes.
        Parameters:
        field - The data attribute, e.g. objectName
        desc - Whether the ordering is ascending or descending order.
        caseSensitive - Whether the ordering should be case-sensitive or not
        Returns:
        The order based on data attributes

      • getOrder

        Order getOrder(BusinessType type,
               BusinessRelationAttribute bra,
               BusinessAttribute field,
               boolean desc,
               boolean caseSensitive)
        Get a new Order based on related attributes.
        Parameters:
        type - The type linked by the bra. (To be removed)
        bra - The relationship attribute, e.g. quoteContainedBy
        field - The field to order based on the related attributed, e.g. objectName or label.
        desc - Whether the ordering is ascending or descending order.
        caseSensitive - Whether the ordering should be case-sensitive or not
        Returns:
        The order based on the related attribute.
